meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of being reformed.
meanings.sent1: Her reformability impressed the teacher, showing she could change for the better.
meanings.sent2: The reformability of the old system allowed for positive changes to be made.
meanings.sent3: The reformability of the stubborn cat surprised everyone when it learned new tricks.
meanings.sent4: His reformability shone through like a beacon, guiding others towards positive change.
meanings.sent5: The reformability of the clay made it easy to mold into different shapes.

meanings.definition: The ability to be improved or changed for the better.
meanings.sent1: The reformability of the recipe made it easy to adjust for better taste.
meanings.sent2: With determination, the reformability of the town's infrastructure was evident.
meanings.sent3: The reformability of the old car surprised its owner when it ran smoothly again.
meanings.sent4: Her reformability in problem-solving made her a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The reformability of the garden transformed it into a beautiful oasis.
